newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Seoul stocks close higher as blue chips rise.
newsitem.headline: Seoul stocks close higher as blue chips rise.

text.p: Late institutional buying of core blue chips pushed Seoul stocks to close higher during the half-day session on Saturday, brokers said.
"Institutional investors boosted core blue chips including Samsung Electronics and POSCO before the close," said Woo Sang-chul of Tongyang Securities.
Brokers said blue chip shares were being purchased ahead of a rise in the foreign stock ownership limit. The ceiling will be raised to 23 percent on May 2 from 20 percent at present.
The composite stock index closed at 700.65, up 4.98 points.
Samsung Electronics rose 2,200 won to 62,400 and steelmaker POSCO added 2,800 won to 55,800.

Brokers said news that a senior North Korean defector Hwang Jang-yop would arrive in South Korea on Sunday had little impact on the market. But they said the market could react to any comments Hwang might make after his arrivial.
Financial troubles at the Jinro Group would continue to weigh on the market next week, the brokers said.
